comment: Take this class!!!! He gives extra credit, is hilarious, and class is entertaining. I hate econ, but got an A in the class and actually enjoyed it. If you have an A after the 3rd exam (or are satisfied with grade) you don't have to come back to class. Study guides are the exams almost word for word. All multiple choice.

Easiest professor ever! Attendance isn't mandatory and he drops your lowest test grade. He puts all his slides and a study guide for every test on D2L. The test questions are taken directly from the study guide. I went to class maybe twice tops per unit, studied the study guides, and still got a 90, a 92, and a 98 on the first three tests.

Definitely recommend Professor Schreiner. Extremely easy. I never went to class except for test days. Didn't study for the first 2 tests (78 and 65) but made flash cards from his study guide for the last exam and studied for maybe 3 hours and got a 95 and still ended the class with a B. If I had tried a little harder could've been an easy A.

My best professor thus far. Go over the study guide and you'll ace the test. The test questions come directly from the study guide. No book needed, no attendance policy, gives extra credit. Excellent professor. Would take again !!!! Take him !!!!!

He an excellent professor in my eyes . By far the most easiest class I had . Class is optional. No attendance policy . He posts all slides to d2l & gives study guides. I didn't go to class when I didn't feel like it . I just went over the study guide & they notes . The questions on the tests were directly from the study guide. 4 tests, drops lowest

There are only 4 tests the entire semester, he drops the lowest test grade! I never went to class took the tests and go an A in the class! He gives study guides for each test make sure to study all of them because the questions on the test come straight from the study guide!

The material is somewhat dry, but Schreiner handled it well. There are 4 exams, and he counts the highest 3. They are taken straight from the slides - no textbook required. I mean I got 100 on 23 of the exams and didn't crack it. He posts all slides to D2L. If you do well on first 3 you don't have to go to class at all the last month. Take him!
This instructor made a boring course interesting.
Great Professor! He's very helpful& really wants you to pass.  We had extra credit to help.  Test are hard.  MUST COME TO CLASS TO PASS.

Good professor. He provides you with several extra credit opportunities (I think we had 3 total). But you have to be IN CLASS to get the points! I only used the book to study for exams. Exams were tough, but ended up with a B in the class.

I liked him. It took me until the 3rd test to get an A on one, but I ended up with an A in the class. Class is optional, he even says that at the beginning. You take 4 tests and he drops the lowest one. Study for the tests, and you'll get an A. He even gives extra credit if you need it. I say take him.

Professor has never taught at KSU until this semester. He has made macroeconomics very challenging. He lets class out early, WHICH IS GOOD, but tests are hard and you feel unprepared. He assignes a good amount of reading so buy the book.
